text: Hi! I posted in the general channel about the empty packages merged into _General_ in the last days: <https://julialang.slack.com/archives/C67910KEH/p1615073123162000> It looks like empty packages generated by _PkgTemplates.jl_ are automatically accepted.

attachments.fallback: [March 6th, 2021 3:25 PM] diegozea: Hi! I have noticed that in the last days, some empty packages have been registered to General. For example, <https://github.com/JuliaConstraints/MetaStrategist.jl/blob/main/src/MetaStrategist.jl> Do you know what the reason for that is?

It looks like empty packages generated by

text:
We should probably add something to RegistryCI that checks if a packages `src/` directory contains at least 5 lines of code.
Error message can be something that's says:

 - you seem to have registered a near empty package. Did you forget to push your commits?
 - Name squatting (E.g. for a package you plan to write later) is no permitted. (Also need to add this to the readme)
• please reregregister once the package contains usable functionality.
• If we have detected this incorrectly (e.g. you package is short but useful) please comment for manual merge.

directory contains at least 5 lines of code.
Error message can be something that's says:

 - you seem to have registered a near empty package. Did you forget to push your commits?

please reregregister once the package contains usable functionality.
If we have detected this incorrectly (e.g. you package is short but useful) please comment for manual merge.

text: It's not fool proof, but it adds friction at the appropriate place.

elements.text: It's not fool proof, but it adds friction at the appropriate place.

attachments.title: Do we need a policy against one-liner registered packages?
attachments.text: I’ve seen a few one or two line packages registered recently. I think the registration process should filter such out, as too soon. WIP is ok with a bit done, but it seem can be misused.
attachments.fallback: JuliaLang: Do we need a policy against one-liner registered packages?
